meanings.definition: A shaft with one or more cams attached, used in internal combustion engines to operate the valves.
meanings.sent1: The camshafts in the engine help control the valves' movements.
meanings.sent2: Mechanics often need to inspect the camshafts for wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The camshafts decided to take a break, causing the engine to sputter comically.
meanings.sent4: The camshafts were the conductors orchestrating the symphony of the engine's performance.
meanings.sent5: The shiny camshafts gleamed under the mechanic's flashlight, revealing their intricate design.

meanings.definition: The part of a machine that controls the opening and closing of valves.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to check the camshafts regularly to ensure smooth valve operation.
meanings.sent2: The camshafts play a crucial role in regulating the flow of fuel in the engine.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous camshafts decided to play hide-and-seek with the valves, causing chaos in the machine.
meanings.sent4: The camshafts were the gatekeepers, allowing only the right amount of air into the engine.
meanings.sent5: With each rotation, the camshafts dictated the rhythm of the engine's heartbeat.
